SENT.plain: The integrity of temporal lobe activity during and after recovery from transient global amnesia (TGA) was assessed in a case study using functional MRI
TGA was associated with scene-encoding deficits in a temporolimbic circuit that recovered over time
Frontoparietal areas recruited during the amnesic state may signify a compensatory reliance on visuospatial or working memory strategies
Reduction of extrastriate cortex responses over repeated testing sessions possibly indicates intact visual priming in TGA
